name: iOS 9 Release
body:
- Optimized for iOS 9 including important performance and reliability improvements.
- Quick Replies: reply to messages from your lock screen. (iOS 9 only)
- 3D Touch Support.
- Latest translations.

---

Compiled dependencies are [available](https://github.com/FredericJacobs/Precompiled-Signal-Dependencies/commit/1101c9b712ac694978812826833de1177e71a7a4).

name: 2.1.3 - Bug fixes
body:
New in 2.1.3: 
- Enhanced onboarding
- Performance speedups & bug fixes
- Updated translations

Make sure to follow us on Twitter (@whispersystems) for updates. All of our code is open-source for you to review! You can also find more information to translate Signal in your language by going to whispersystems.org.

---

Built with Xcode 6.4 (6E35b) on OS X 10.10.5 (14F27)
Compiled dependencies are [available](https://github.com/FredericJacobs/Precompiled-Signal-Dependencies/commit/0f4532971e696c73005950fa7d9154297fdfa746).
Git tag was signed with @FredericJacobs's GPG key

name: 2.1.1 - Bug fixes
body:
New in 2.1.1: Reliability enhancements.

New in 2.1:
- Improved notifications - See the message details you expect without
  sacrificing any privacy. Control how much information you would like to
  be displayed. View the count of unread messages that are waiting in
  other threads from any conversation view. Swipe from the lock screen or
  tap any incoming notification to go directly to that conversation.
- Preliminary Apple Watch support!
- Better phone calls - Continuous vibration while an incoming call is
  ringing. Faster call connection speed. Missed call notifications that
  allow you to quickly dial back.
- Updated layout - The Inbox and Archive toggles have been moved to the
  top of the screen and are now easier to select.
- Enhanced speed
- Numerous bug fixes

---

Built with Xcode 6.3.2 (6D2105) on OS X 10.10.3 (14D136)
Compiled dependencies are [available](https://github.com/FredericJacobs/Precompiled-Signal-Dependencies/commit/41c8315a35ded3d7714fbb6daee02ee972aea54f).
Git tag was signed with @FredericJacobs's GPG key

name: 2.1 - Notifications
body:
New in 2.1:
- Improved notifications - See the message details you expect without
  sacrificing any privacy. Control how much information you would like to
  be displayed. View the count of unread messages that are waiting in
  other threads from any conversation view. Swipe from the lock screen or
  tap any incoming notification to go directly to that conversation.
- Preliminary Apple Watch support!
- Better phone calls - Continuous vibration while an incoming call is
  ringing. Faster call connection speed. Missed call notifications that
  allow you to quickly dial back.
- Updated layout - The Inbox and Archive toggles have been moved to the
  top of the screen and are now easier to select.
- Enhanced speed
- Numerous bug fixes

New in 2.0.2:
- In-App Notifications
- Improved contact discovery
- Performance improvements
- Bug fixes
- Improved localizations. You can participate in the translation effort too: https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/signal-ios/

---

Built with Xcode 6.2 (6C131e) on OS X 10.10.2 (14C1514)
Compiled dependencies are [available](https://github.com/FredericJacobs/Precompiled-Signal-Dependencies/commit/7897ccc4691461387f067c6fc8baeeef249f32cb).
Git tag was signed with @FredericJacobs's GPG key

New in 2.0.1:
- You can now draft messages and come back later to send them.
- Multiple bug and performance fixes.
- More translations.

Security you can write home about. Now on iOS.
- TextSecure protocol support! Send free text, picture, and video messages anywhere in the world.
- Enjoy a brand-new design that seamlessly blends phone calls and messaging in an elegant (and fast!) interface.
- Focus only on what's important by quickly organizing your conversations using the improved archive feature.
- Numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements.

---

Git tag was signed with @FredericJacobs's GPG key

name: 2.0 - Release
body:
Security you can write home about. Now on iOS.
- TextSecure protocol support! Send free text, picture, and video messages anywhere in the world.
- Enjoy a brand-new design that seamlessly blends phone calls and messaging in an elegant (and fast!) interface.
- Focus only on what's important by quickly organizing your conversations using the improved archive feature.
- Numerous bug fixes and performance enhancements.

name: App Store - 1.0.8
body:
- Bug fixes (fixes crash when opening contacts)
- Better retro-compatibility with iOS7
- Updated translations

Did you know that Signal is Free software? 
You can contribute to the code (https://github.com/WhisperSystems/Signal-iOS) or to translations (https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/signal-ios/).

You can follow us on Twitter (@WhisperSystems) for more frequent development updates.

---

Built with Xcode 6.1 (6A1052d) on OS X (14A389)
Git tag was signed with @FredericJacobs's GPG key

name: App Store - 1.0.7
body:
- Addresses critical issue on iOS7 causing the app to crash on launch
- Random bug fixes and updated translations

Built on Yosemite (14A379a) with Xcode 6.0.1 (6A317)

name: App Store - 1.0.6
body:
- Bug and performance fixes
- Support for larger screen-sizes (iPhone 6/6+)
- Updated translations. 

PS: Did you know you could contribute to the translations too? Meet you at https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/signal-ios/ 

Built on Yosemite (14A379a) with Xcode 6.0.1 (6A317)

name: App Store release - iOS 8 Support
body:
- Supporting iOS 8
- Rewriting PushManager to extensively use futures
- Pick up calls directly from the lock-screen
- Bug fixes
- Updating translations

Built on Mavericks (13F34) with Xcode Version 6.0 (6A313)

name: App Store - 1.0.4
body:
- Screen Security : You can now disable system screenshots on app switching in the settings. 
- Enhanced support for multiple address books 
- Enhanced local storage protection 
- Numerous bug fixes
